00022 //
00023 #include "chipstream/CelReader.h"
00024 //
00025 #include "chipstream/DiskIntensityMart.h"
00026 #include "chipstream/IdxGroup.h"
00027 //
00028 #include "calvin_files/data/src/GenericData.h"
00029 #include "calvin_files/fusion/src/FusionCELData.h"
00030 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/StringUtils.h"
00031 #include "util/Convert.h"
00032 #include "util/Fs.h"
00033 #include "util/Err.h"
00034 #include "util/Util.h"
00035 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00036 
00037 using namespace affymetrix_fusion_io;
00038 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_utilities;
00039 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_exceptions;
00040 
00041 /**
00042  * @brief Do the heavy lifting of reading data from the cel files
00043  * and passing to all the streams and intensity marts.
00044  * @return true on success or false on error.
00045  */
00046 bool CelReader::readFiles() {
00047     int size = 0;
00048     int cel_channel_count = 0;
00049 //   double newChip_times = 0, setProbeIntensity_times = 0, CelListener_newChip_times = 0;
00050 //   clock_t clock1, clock2;
00051     /* sanity checks. */
00052     Err::check(m_FileNames.size() > 0, "CelReader::readFiles() - Can't specify 0 files to read.");
00053     Err::check(m_Streams.size() > 0 || m_IntenMarts.size() > 0 || m_CelListeners.size() > 0,
00054                "CelReader::readFiles() - Must specify a stream or IntensityMart to read into.");
00055 
00056     /* @todo: allow for more than one intensity mart?? */
00057     if (m_IntenMarts.size() > 1 && m_Streams.size() > 0) {
00058         Verbose::warn(0, "CelReader::readFiles -- more than one IntensityMart registered.  Using first one to populate ChipStreams.");
00059     }
00060 
00061     Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading and pre-processing " + ToStr(m_FileNames.size()) + " cel files", m_FileNames.size(), 0, m_FileNames.size());
00062 
00063     // %HACK% making extra marts for each chipstream.  first mart pointer will
00064     // be for raw intensities, and not passed on to a chipstream.
00065     if (m_IntenMarts.size() > 0 ) {
00066         int stream_mart_diff = m_Streams.size() - m_IntenMarts.size();
00067         if (stream_mart_diff >= 0) {
00068             for (int m = 0; m < stream_mart_diff + 1; m++) {
00069                 IntensityMart* dm = m_IntenMarts[0]->copyMetaDataToEmptyMart();
00070                 m_IntenMarts.push_back(dm);
00071             }
00072         }
00073     }
00074 
00075         
00076 
00077     std::vector<float> data;
00078     for (int fileIx=0; fileIx < m_FileNames.size(); fileIx++) {
00079 
00080     // process cel file
00081     FusionCELData cel;
00082     Verbose::progressStep(1);
00083     try {
00084       std::string tmp_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(m_FileNames[fileIx]);
00085       cel.SetFileName(tmp_unc_name.c_str());
00086         if(!cel.Read())
00087             Err::errAbort("\nCan't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() +
00088                 "\n>>> Error reported: " + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetError()));
00089 
00090             // If this is a AGCC CEL file, then get channel names.  If
00091             // this is a GCOS CEL file, then an empty vector is returned.
00092             std::vector<std::wstring> data_channels = cel.GetChannels();
00093 
00094         for (int chanIx = 0; chanIx < data_channels.size(); chanIx++) {
00095           Verbose::out(4,"In cel file '"+m_FileNames[fileIx] +"' found channel '"+StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(data_channels[chanIx])+"'");
00096         }
00097 
00098             // If this is a GCOS CEL file, then make up any old name for a
00099             // single channel -- subsequent call to SetActiveDataGroup
00100             // will be a no-op in this case, and GetIntensities will
00101             // proceed as normal.
00102             if (data_channels.empty()) {
00103                 std::wstring temp = L"Default Group";
00104                 data_channels.push_back(temp);
00105             }
00106 
00107             std::vector<unsigned int> channel_group;
00108             for (int chanIx = 0; chanIx < data_channels.size(); chanIx++) {
00109                 cel.SetActiveDataGroup(data_channels[chanIx]);
00110 
00111                 /* Check number of entries in cel file. */
00112                 if (fileIx == 0)
00113                     size = cel.GetRows() * cel.GetCols();
00114                 else
00115                     assert(size == cel.GetRows() * cel.GetCols());
00116                 data.resize(size);
00117                 cel.GetIntensities(0,data);
00118 
00119                                 // Compute saturation 
00120                                 int nsat = 0;
00121                                 for (int icel=0; icel< size; icel++)
00122                                 {
00123                                         if (data[icel] >= 3800)
00124                                                 nsat++;
00125                                 }
00126 
00127                                 double sat = (double)nsat/(double)size;
00128 
00129                                 if (m_Saturation.size () < m_FileNames.size ()*data_channels.size())
00130                                         m_Saturation.resize ( m_FileNames.size ()*data_channels.size() );
00131 
00132                                 m_Saturation[data_channels.size()*fileIx+chanIx] = sat;
00133 
00134                 /* Load data into our intensity marts. */
00135                 //     clock1 = clock();
00136                 for (int index = 0; index < m_IntenMarts.size(); index++) {
00137 
00138                     m_IntenMarts[index]->setProbeIntensity(data_channels.size()*fileIx+chanIx, data);
00139                 }
00140                 //     clock2 = clock();
00141                 //     setProbeIntensity_times += clock2 - clock1;
00142 
00143                 channel_group.push_back(cel_channel_count++);
00144             }
00145             /* Pass data to cel listeners */
00146             for (int index = 0; index < m_CelListeners.size(); index++) {
00147                 m_CelListeners[index]->newChip(&cel);
00148             }
00149             m_CelChannels.addGroup("channels", channel_group);
00150             cel.Close();
00151         }
00152         catch(const Except &e) {
00153             Err::errAbort(ToStr("\n") + e.what());
00154         }
00155         catch(const std::bad_alloc &e) {
00156             Err::errAbort("\nRan out of memory when reading cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() + "\n");
00157         }
00158         catch(CalvinException &ce) {
00159             Err::errAbort("\nAGCC error when reading cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() + "\n"
00160                           "Description: '" +StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(ce.Description()) + "'");
00161         }
00162         catch(const std::exception &e) {
00163             Err::errAbort("\nException caught. Message is: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00164         }
00165         catch (...) {
00166             Err::errAbort("\nUnknown problem when reading cel file: " + cel.GetFileName() + "\n");
00167         }
00168     } // end reading cel files
00169 
00170     Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00171 
00172     std::string plural = (m_Streams.size() > 1 ? "s" : "");
00173 
00174     if (m_IntenMarts.size() > 0) {
00175         for (int martIx = 0; martIx < m_IntenMarts.size(); martIx++) {
00176             m_IntenMarts[martIx]->setChannelMapping(m_CelChannels);
00177         }
00178 
00179         if (m_Streams.size() > 0) {
00180             Verbose::out(1, "Processing " + ToStr(m_Streams.size()) + " chipstream" + plural + ".");
00181             for (int index = 0; index < m_Streams.size(); index++) {
00182                 m_Streams[index]->newDataSet(m_IntenMarts[index+1]);
00183             }
00184         }
00185     }
00186 
00187     if (m_Streams.size() > 0)
00188         Verbose::out(1, "Finalizing " + ToStr(m_Streams.size()) + " chipstream"+plural+".");
00189     for (int index = 0; index < m_Streams.size(); index++) {
00190         if (m_Streams[index] != NULL)
00191             m_Streams[index]->endDataSet();
00192     }
00193 
00194     return true;
00195 }
Generated on Tue Jul 15 2014 10:37:34 for Affymetrix Power Tools by  1.7.1
